column4: i installed win7 but grub2 after upddate-grub doesn't launch it. what to do?
this might be your problem: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1264151&highlight=grub+invalid+signature&page=2
you could try pastebinning your grub.conf and "fdisk -l" output
a minute
grub.cfg http://pastebin.com/m5e878820
i think there's a problem with hd0 and hd1 but i don't know how to change it
also "fdisk -l" and "/etc/default/grub"
sudo fdisk -l
http://pastebin.com/m7dc1e14d
do you have windows 7 on sda (hd0) or sdb (hd1)?
sda in fact but there's always a problem with it
do these: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Grub2#Dual-booting

doesn't work. win7 is in the boot menu but doesn't boot. I had a problem while installing windows partion was for example on hd0 but then in ubuntu it became hd1. It's easy to fix in grub but not in grub2. so that's the problem
you did osprobe?
i did
and ubuntu works fine?
oh yeah, ubuntu works, did you mean why do i want win7? :D
no, just curious that grub2 doesn't work just for 7
but grub worked great, should i downgrade grub?
it looks like it's pointing to the right place if 7 is on sda. i guess you could try downgrading
how to change sda to sdb in grub2?
try this: http://erickoo.wordpress.com/2009/06/14/how-to-add-vista-partition-to-grub-2-ubuntu-9-10-karmic-koala/
only have:    set root=(hd0,2)
thanks a lot, man. I'll try do my self. Thanks for great help ))
